poem:
Title: "Shadows of the Same Sun"

Hours unfold as origami cranes in Cathy's hands,
A week to her, a languorous season of longing.
Max breathes in the calendar's sameness,
Each day an indiscernible repetition,
Only a wing-beat from their shared intimacy.
Two lovers, two chronometers at odds,
In the end, don't we all dance to our own metronome?
